summary_md: Round focus: Conjecture 7.2 (units of the Habiro ring Z[q]^N are exactly ±q^i). Proven/established this round: torsion units are ±1; p-adic congruences along μ_{p^∞}; a corrected rigidity lemma that u(ζ)=±ζ^i at infinitely many prime-power ζ forces u=±q^i (uses τ injectivity over that infinite set). New milestone: Laurent-polynomial units resolved — any g∈Z[q,q^{-1}] that is a unit in Z[q]^N equals ±q^i (finite-field reduction); consequently alternating sums γ_m (odd m≥3) are not units. Additional tools: p-adic valuation lemmas and a uniform truncation lemma on μ_{p^∞}, plus a determinant/product identity ∏_{ζ^n=1}u(ζ)=±1. Main remaining gap: promote p-adic congruences to infinitely many exact equalities u(ζ_{p^a})=±ζ_{p^a}^i. Citations: proofs.md; papers/paper1.tex
highlights: Torsion units in Z[q]^N are trivial: u^m=1 ⇒ u=±1.
Laurent-polynomial units settled: if g∈Z[q,q^{-1}] is a unit in Z[q]^N then g=±q^i; hence γ_m (odd m≥3) are not units.
p-adic congruence and valuation lemmas: for odd p and primitive p^a-root ζ, u(ζ)≡u(1) (mod p) and v_𝔭(ζ^k−1)=v_𝔭(ζ−1)+v_p(k); uniform truncation of (ζ)_n gives control mod p^r.
Rigidity (corrected): infinite exact monomial evaluations u(ζ)=±ζ^i for prime-power ζ imply u=±q^i via injectivity of τ on that infinite set.
Determinant/product identity: for unit u, ∏_{ζ^n=1}u(ζ)=±1, usable as an auxiliary global constraint.
next_questions: Find a mechanism to upgrade p-adic congruences along μ_{p^∞} to infinitely many exact equalities u(ζ_{p^a})=±ζ_{p^a}^i (or produce a counterexample).
Carry out the p-adic-tower analysis and two-prime synthesis: force the same exponent i for two distinct odd primes and apply τ-injectivity to conclude u=±q^i.
Clarify and fix the precise formulation of Conjecture 7.2 (unit-group statement vs. general τ-injectivity) to set the final proof target.
